### Map
#### Subsection

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source='fold-hide', fig.width=1920/72, fig.height=1080/72, out.width="100%"}

# PLOT NATURAL EARTH BORDERS
ne_world <- ne_countries(scale = "medium", returnclass = "sf")
# class(ne_world)

# removes Antarctica
ne_world <- filter(ne_world, iso_a3 != "ATA") 

# theme parameters
theme_opts <- theme(
  legend.position = "bottom",
  legend.title = element_blank(),
  axis.text = element_blank(),
  axis.line = element_blank(),
  axis.ticks = element_blank(),
  axis.title = element_blank(),
  panel.grid = element_blank(),
  panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
  panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
  panel.background=element_rect(fill="white", colour="white"),
  panel.border = element_blank(),
  plot.background = element_blank(),
)

# color palette to use
pal <- wes_palette("Zissou1", 10, type = "continuous")

v1 <- ggplot(data = ne_world) +
  # map feature styling
  geom_sf(fill="white", color="#888888", stroke=0.5) +
  # bubble parameters
  geom_point( data = df, aes(x=LONGITUDE, y=LATITUDE, size=PM25, color=PM25), alpha=0.8) +
  # size scaling applied to bubbles
  scale_size_continuous(range=c(1,12)) +
  scale_fill_gradientn(colours = pal) + 
  scale_color_gradientn(colours = pal) + 
  theme_bw() +
  labs(x="Longitude",
       y="Latitude",
       title = "Bubble Map", 
       subtitle="Top 10000 Cities of the World") +
  theme_opts

girafe(ggobj = v1, width_svg = 1280/72, height_svg = 720/72,
       options = list(opts_sizing(rescale = TRUE, width = 1.0))
)

```


